lines.text: You know, Ma, I bet you once had an hourglass figure.
Yeah, but the sand sure shifted.
Pa, you're lazier than that old hound dog we used to have.
Which one?
The one that used to lean against the wall when she barked.
What name have you decided to give the child?
Well, we sort of thought we'd name him after his father.
Thomas? Oh, but, my dear, Thomas is such an ordinary name, it has no... no character, no color.
Thomas Jefferson's name was Thomas!

[about Elizabeth's choice of name for Tom's child]
I bet she hangs around until after the christening to make sure the baby gets the name she wants.
What name does she want?
Jonathan.
But Kim and I had sort of decided on Thomas?
Well, she's decided different. She says, "Thomas is too ordinary, it has no character, no color."
You know, I'm sorry about the way Mrs. Parker treated you fellas yesterday.
Eastern squaw pretty fresh!
No, she's from society. She don't understand us kind of folks, claims her ancestors came over on the Mayflower.
Huh, that nothing. Mine here to greet them.
Well, I never thought of that.
Income tax? What's that?
Well, income tax supports the government.
You mean, Pa and me's got to support all our kids and the government too?
